title: league of legend community is really toxic
body:
i have been playing league of legends for 9 months now and i have realised out of all the online games i played (including call of duty and overwatch), this game has the most toxic community. every single game now a days i get flamed for low cs, loosing lane, not roaming well, etc. (keep in mind most of these games are draft pick). But ranked is a different story. it almost seems pointless climbing in ranked because the higher i go the more toxic it gets. i am currently in silver 1 and if the enemy gets first blood my teammate would either flame or give up.  its become so bad that every game i have to /mute all which i hate doing because i want to communicate with my team. some to most of the flame is racial slurs or demotivating comments and if i report it nothng happens. its really sad 

sorry but i feel as if i needed to make this statement because nothing is being done about it

Riot actually does a decent job at regulating toxicity. It's just never noticed because of the big player base and because pretty much 99% of the people in the game are toxic.

Verbal offenses are like the main things that gets punished. Every day theres dozens of posts here from people who got punished for their verbal toxicity. So dont worry about nothing being done. The problem is the massive playerbase. You're always gonna find a new person who flames you, or a new account they flame you from. Tons of people have numerous accounts (I think). I have 3 or 4 myself. I dont flame people over their video game skills because I would feel like a massive douchebag thinking that not being good at a video game is a bad thing or something, but the point still stands. Tons of players with tons of accounts. Gonna have to pick, have chat and deal with things out of your control, or have control by muting, or just not play the game :/
Honestly. NGL today I had a minor mental breakdown over the toxicity in the game, so muting people is honestly the way to go, especially if you are just looking for fun.
